alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued April 01 at 11:10AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR BLOWING DUST FROM 1100 AM SATURDAY UNTIL 800 PM SATURDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust. WHERE...Saguache, Douglas, Elbert, Kit Carson, Lincoln, Teller, Cheyenne, El Paso, Kiowa, Pueblo, Bent, Prowers, Otero, Huerfano, Rio Grande, Alamosa, Las Animas, Baca, Costilla, Conejos and Crowley Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Saguache, Castle Rock, Kiowa, Burlington, Limon, Cripple Creek, Cheyenne Wells, Colorado Springs, Eads, Pueblo, Las Animas, Lamar, La Junta, Walsenburg, Del Norte, South Fork, Alamosa, Kim, Trinidad, Springfield, San Luis, Conejos and Ordway. WHEN...1100 AM Saturday April 01 to 800 PM Saturday April 01 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust Issued for the eastern plains of Colorado and the San Luis Valley Issued at 10:00 AM MDT, Saturday, April 1st, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: Douglas, Elbert, Lincoln, Kit Carson, Cheyenne, Teller, El Paso, Pueblo, Crowley, Kiowa, Otero, Bent, Prowers, Huerfano, Las Animas, Baca, Saguache, Alamosa, Rio Grande, Conejos, and Costilla. Locations include, but are not limited to Alamosa, San Luis, Lamar, Monument, Trinidad, Ordway, Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Burlington, Hugo, Springfield, La Junta, Eads, La Veta Pass, Trinidad, Boone, and Las Animas. Advisory in Effect: 11:00 AM MDT, Saturday, April 1, 2023 to 8:00 PM MDT, Saturday, April 1, 2023. Public Health Recommendations: If significant blowing dust is present and reducing visibility to less than 10 miles across a wide area, People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children in the affected area should reduce prolonged or heavy indoor and outdoor exertion. Outlook: Strong and gusty winds will produce areas of blowing dust on Saturday. The threat for blowing dust will gradually diminish by Saturday evening. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms in sensitive individuals, aggravation of heart or lung disease and premature mortality in people with cardiopulmonary disease and older adults. People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
